abstract: Massachusetts has decided, on recommendation of State Education Commissioner Mitchell Chester, to abandon national standardized test based on Common Core requirements in favor of developing its own; move represents startling reversal for Chester, early proponent of standardized testing, and for state, known for successful education reform; foreshadows similar rejections across nation.
lead_paragraph: As states have rejected tests tied to the Common Core standards, no about-face has resonated more than that of Massachusetts, known as a leader in education reform.

headline.main: Massachusetts’s Rejection of Common Core Test Signals Shift in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Rejecting Test, Massachusetts Shifts Its Model

snippet: As states have rejected tests tied to the Common Core standards, no about-face has resonated more than that of Massachusetts, known as a leader in education reform.
